context_meta.title: NFL seeks special investigator in concussion settlement
context_meta.summary: The NFL accused some lawyers representing players in the $1 billion concussion settlement of fraud and wants a special investigator appointed. Plaintiffs' lawyers contend the league is not awarding settlement funds fast enough. So far, $227 million in claims have been awarded. The league made its request Friday in U.S. District Court for Eastern Pennsylvania, saying that attorneys, doctors and former players are attempting to cheat the program. The NFL cited an independent study that recommended denying more than 400 claims because of fraud, including schemes by lawyers and medical personnel working with former players. "We want to ensure that players and their families receive the benefits they

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Broncos' 2018 schedule should be announced next week
context_meta.summary: We already know the Denver Broncos' tentative preseason schedule, although three of those dates still have to be finalized. We should soon know the team's regular season schedule, too. Last year, the NFL announced its regular season schedule one week before the draft. If the league follows that same format this year, the 2018 regular season schedule will be announced on Thursday, April 19. There's no guarantee April 19 will be the exact date of this year's schedule release, but we do know the schedule should be arriving soon. Expect the league to announce it at least before the draft, which starts on April 26. Denver's home opponents this year are the Kansas City Chiefs, Los Angeles Chargers,

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Ryan Leaf on Baker Mayfield: 'sounds like 1998 version of Leaf'
context_meta.summary: Ryan Leaf thinks Baker Mayfield might be the next Ryan Leaf. In an interview on "The Ken Carman Show with Anthony Lima" on 92.3 in Cleveland, Leaf was talking about the upcoming class of quarterbacks. To have success in the NFL, Leaf said the key for the prospects will be how they deal with failure. He believes former USC quarterback Sam Darnold has the tools to evolve, but sees some of his past self in Mayfield. "A good litmus test for me is always when I listen to radio interviews or TV interviews, I tend to close my eyes and just listen to the voice, and hear the answer. I always say, 'if it sounds like the 1998 version of Ryan Leaf, there's definitely a red flag that needs to be raised there,"

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Ravens, Rams to hold joint practices this summer
context_meta.summary: Ravens wide receiver Michael Crabtree and Rams cornerback Aqib Talib aren't scheduled to face each other in the regular season, but they will have a chance to catch up with one another over the summer. According to multiple reports, the Ravens and Rams have agreed to hold joint practices this summer before they play a preseason game in Baltimore on August 9. It will be the first preseason game for the Rams while the Ravens will be playing in the Hall of Fame Game against the Bears in the league's first exhibition game of the summer. Crabtree and Talib were both ejected from a game between the Raiders and Broncos last season after a fight that started when Talib, who was then with Denver, tore a chain off Crabtree's neck while Crabtree was blocking him.

context_meta.title: NFL's most overpaid players: Jimmy Garoppolo, Kirk Cousins highlight list
context_meta.summary: SportsPulse: Trysta Krick gets the inside scoop on Andrew Luck's shoulder injury from the Indianapolis Star's Stephen Holder, who thinks the Colts quarterback will finally be healthy this NFL season. Pro athletes are overpaid.  In the context of what they contribute to society compared to teachers, police officers, firemen and the like, who's going to argue? Yet who should complain given the perspective of professional sports market forces that easily support nine-figure, multi-year contracts? context_meta.summary: San Francisco 49ers linebacker Reuben Foster had some teammate support at his arraignment Thursday. New 49ers cornerback Richard Sherman and safety Jaquiski Tartt were in the courtroom, according to Matt Barrows of the Sacramento Bee.  Foster was charged with felony domestic violence by the Santa Clara District Attorney. According to the DA, Foster "physically attacked" his unidentified 28-year old girlfriend "during a February argument at their Los Gatos (California) home."  In addition to the domestic violence charge, Foster also faces charges of having inflicted great bodily injury;  forcefully attempting to prevent a victim from reporting a crime; and possession of an assault weapon, all

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Report: Kaepernick's visit with Seahawks postponed
context_meta.summary: The Seattle Seahawks postponed a workout for Colin Kaepernick after the free-agent quarterback declined to stop kneeling during the national anthem next season, ESPN's Adam Schefter reported on Thursday. The Seahawks contacted Kaepernick approximately two weeks ago to arrange a visit before the plans were altered unexpectedly due to his anthem stance, Schefter reported, citing a source. Per Schefter, Kaepernick was unwilling to say that he would alter his anthem stance that began in 2016 as a means to protest police brutality and racial injustice. The workout had been scheduled for Monday, according to Pro Football Talk, which added that it was only when the workout date approached that the Seahawks contacted Kaepernick to request that he commit to standing for the anthem.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: NFL rejects Burfict's appeal, upholds 4-game suspension
context_meta.summary: CINCINNATI (AP) — Bengals linebacker Vontaze Burfict will be sidelined to start a season for the fourth year in a row, this time serving a four-game suspension for violating the NFL's policy on performance-enhancers. The NFL rejected Burfict's appeal without comment and upheld the full suspension on Thursday. It's the third time the volatile linebacker has been suspended by the league in the past three years. The Bengals are accustomed to going without their most valuable defensive player, whom they've steadfastly supported throughout his suspension-shortened career. They even gave him a three-year contract extension last season while he was serving a three-game suspension from the league. They'll

Unfortunately, NFL.com's Nate Burleson doesn't see that happening as he projected Moncrief to put up similar figures to those he had in 2017. Old team: Indianapolis Colts. context_meta.title: Who's First? Four Potential Opening-Day Foes
context_meta.summary: On Wednesday, the NFL revealed its 2018 preseason schedule, which includes a nationally-televised game for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. That appetizer heralded the imminent arrival of the main course: the full, 256-game regular-season schedule, which is likely to be announced next week. That is the more anticipated news, of course, and Buccaneer fans have an additional reason to be eager for the schedule drop: For the first time, they'll be able to buy single-game tickets as soon as the schedule is revealed. context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Projections for the 2018 draft's top RBs
context_meta.summary: Nathan Forster Saquon Barkley, who is perhaps the most hyped running back prospect since Reggie Bush, arrives at an interesting point in NFL history. The running back is no longer a "premier" position in the draft -- NFL teams would much rather use a high pick on a quarterback, offensive tackle, pass-rusher, or wide receiver. Proponents of advanced statistics have been at the forefront of this change of thinking, pointing out that running backs often have short careers and are usually replaced with ease. Accordingly, any team willing to go against this trend and use a high pick on Barkley should be fairly certain that he is likely to live up to his hype. Enter BackCAST, which is Football Outsiders'

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Packers QB Aaron Rodgers offers tips to top NFL prospect Josh Rosen
context_meta.summary: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has had a busy off-season.  He has supported girlfriend and driver Danica Patrick at the Daytona 500, played in golf events and met with the Dalai Lama as part of a philanthropic mission to India with Starkey Hearing Foundation. The Super Bowl champion and two-time NFL most valuable player has squeezed some football into his off-season calendar. Recently UCLA quarterback and top draft prospect Josh Rosen received a crash course from Rodgers on what it takes to be a successful signal caller at the highest level. In a video, which is part of the NFL Network's “Destination Dallas: Drive to the NFL Draft” series, the two quarterbacks from California discussed proper throwing
